intro: Silene jeniseensis, commonly known as the Siberian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Siberia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, arctic or alpine environments. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and small, alternate leaves. Silene jeniseensis is often found in open habitats such as tundra and mountain meadows.
